titleStmt.title: Fenton M. Henderson to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2166

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
LEESBURG, LOUDOUN COUNTY, VA,
Augt 25th, 1865.
To His Excellency the Governor of the State of Kentucky.
Sir,

I respectfully ask for the appointment of Commissioner to take acknowledgment of Deeds, &c., for the State of Kentucky. I am now a Commissioner in Chancery and for Stating Accounts of Fiduciaries, and also a Notary Public for said ^this^ County. Should you appoint me to said position, please send me the forms, prescribed in your State, for taking such acknowledgments.

I refer, with their permission, to the folloiwng named gentlemen:
John Janney, Attorney at Law,
Matthew Harrison. "
Jno. M. Orr, "
W. B. Downey, "
Dr. T. H. Clagett,
Dr. A. R. Mott,
C. P. Janney, Clerk of County Court,
G. K. Fox, jr., Deputy Clerk.

Comr Deeds
Virginia
F. M. Henderson
comd
30th Aug 1865
